Shows discrete data.

Used to identify correlation.

A number used to support or reject a hypothesis.

Typically set at 0.05 or 0.01.

An observation far from other observations.
Can have a large effect on the mean.

A type of probability sampling.
Selecting every nth individual from a list.

Used to test a hypothesis.

Having multiple peaks.

A number between -1 and 1 that measures the strength of a linear relationship.

Not included in the study.
Can cause a spurious correlation.

The relationship between cause and effect.
Proven by a controlled experiment.
Not the same as correlation.

Ex: a person lying on a survey.

A key part of the scientific method.

Repeating a study to see if the same results are obtained.
